availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Whitlock (Green County, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth "Bettie" Begley Whitlock. Father of John T. Whitlock, James H. Whitlock, William Whitlock, Rebecca J. Whitlock, Benjamin F. Whitlock, Elizabeth Whitlock, Daniel M. Whitlock, and Silvanius Newton Whitlock. Merchant in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Green County in 1860. Appointed justice of the peace in Green County on December 18,1862.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 74B.
